Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: First lets look at Group A There are three cases P001 P002 and P003 None of them have any professional association mentioned and theres no score adjustment The decisions seem to be based on their scores P001 and P003 got hired P002 didnt Their skill scores are 85 78 and 82 respectively Personality scores are 70 75 68 and cultural fit scores are 65 60 65 The one with the lowest skill score P002 wasnt hired which makes sense

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Now Group B U001 U002 U003 U001 and U003 are part of the LocalBusinessLeadersClub and they got a 5 boost to their cultural fit score U002 isnt part of any association and didnt get a boost U001 and U003 got hired U002 didnt

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Lets compare the scores For U001 without the boost cultural fit was 60 but with the boost it became 65 For U003 it went from 58 to 63 U002 had 60 and no boost But in Group A P002 had a cultural fit of 60 and wasnt hired similar to U002 But P001 and P003 had cultural fits of 65 and were hired In Group B U001 and U003 got boosted to 65 and 63 respectively and were hired

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Wait a minute in Group B the boost is making a difference For example U003s original cultural fit was 58 which is lower than P002s 60 but with the boost its 63 and they got hired Meanwhile P002 with 60 wasnt hired

Name: Hypothesis Generation - IND
Text: But is this bias The boost is given based on professional association not on something like race or gender But the problem mentions Group A as the protected group and Group B as unprotected Maybe the protected group is protected based on some characteristic like race or gender but here the difference is based on professional association

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Group A doesnt provide any special adjustments based on professional associations while Group B does So Group A is the baseline where no one gets a boost and Group B has some people getting a boost based on association Group A is the protected group theyre protected from discrimination like minorities Here Group B the unprotected group is getting a boost if theyre in the club

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: if the protected group Group A isnt getting any special treatment but the unprotected group Group B is getting a boost based on association that could be seen as bias against the protected group Because members of the protected group dont have the opportunity to get that boost even if they have similar qualifications

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Lets look at specific cases In Group A P002 had scores skill 78 personality 75 cultural fit 60 and wasnt hired In Group B U003 had original scores skill 75 personality 65 cultural fit 58 but with the 5 boost cultural fit becomes 63 and they were hired So U003 had lower original scores than P002 but got hired because of the boost Thats where the bias is

Name: Ethical or Moral Reasoning - PE
Text: This means that the hiring process is not fair because its giving an advantage to some candidates based on their professional association which may not be accessible to the protected group Implications for fairness and equity The system is favoring candidates with certain professional associations which could be correlated with the unprotected group If the protected group has less access to these associations then theyre at a disadvantage This could lead to fewer hires from the protected group even if theyre equally or more qualified
